snippet: The accuser, a 30-year-old former Marine, said a priest tried to rape him in 1996.
abstract: Former Marine takes the stand in the landmark trial of two Philadelphia priests, including Rev James Brennan, recounting in detail how Brennan attempted to rape him in 1996, when he was 14 years old; contends that the sexual assault led him down a dark path that included more than a decade of drug and alcohol abuse, multiple criminal convictions and three suicide attempts.
lead_paragraph: The accuser, a 30-year-old former Marine, said a priest tried to rape him in 1996.

headline.seo: Accuser Describes Rape Attempt by Philadelphia Priest
headline.main: Accuser Describes Attack by Priest in Pennsylvania
headline.print_headline: Accuser Describes Attack By Priest in Pennsylvania
